column4: I am running UBUNTU 6.06 server and have attached a windows network drive via cifs I have an intermittent problem when I copy files to the shared drive I get a "Bad file Descriptor" message, I can't see a pattern it seams to be random although I have only had it happen on a larger file (around 300 meg) and it transfers part of the file, always the same amount of bytes before aborting
Is there a better way to mount the drive?
not sure, but I think I've had similar problems when doing such things... think it's slight incompatibilities between versions of the SMB protocol
